Authors: Takashi Shirouzu, Dai Hirose, Seiji Tokumasu
Title:
Potential of a baiting method for biodiversity survey of
mucoralean and allied fungi
Abstract:
We investigated the availability of a baiting method to
isolate mucoralean and allied fungi from soil samples. Two different
substrates, dried small shrimps and petals of hibiscus flowers, were
selected as baits. Soil samples were collected from temperate and
subtropical regions in Japan. Six genera 16 species widely distributed
in Mucorales and Mortierellales lineages were isolated, suggesting the
baiting method is useful for the biodiversity survey of mucoralean and
allied fungi.
